messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, better technology and health care meant fewer children died when they were young, so the world’s population grew very quickly. These families were large, and they had even more children who lived to become adults and then had children of their own. In the 1960s, people got broader access to contraception, which means methods to avoid pregnancy. This caused the worldwide average number of children per woman to fall from six to about two.
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as A2 rather than the required B1 level because it uses overly simple vocabulary and sentence structures. For example, “people got broader access to contraception, which means methods to avoid pregnancy” resorts to a basic definition and simple clauses. The connector use is minimal, making the text feel too elementary. To reach B1, introduce mid‐level linking words (such as “as a result,” “consequently,” or “therefore”) and richer verb forms. Replace “better technology and health care” with “improvements in technology and healthcare,” and rephrase the contraception sentence into a more complex structure: for example, “As contraception became more widely accessible in the 1960s, global fertility rates fell from six to around two children per woman.” Avoid interrupting the flow with dictionary‐style definitions and aim for cohesive, compound sentences that reflect B1 complexity.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and healthcare meant that fewer children died in childhood, and as a result, the world’s population grew rapidly. These large families went on to have even more children, many of whom survived into adulthood and later had children of their own. In the 1960s, as contraception (methods to prevent pregnancy) became more widely accessible, global fertility rates dropped from an average of six children per woman to about two.
Feedback received: Grade 7/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The output was classified as B2 rather than the required B1. For example, the sentence “Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and healthcare meant that fewer children died in childhood, and as a result, the world’s population grew rapidly.” contains the term “healthcare” (a B2/C1 item) and is a long, compound structure. To meet B1 level, replace “healthcare” with “health,” simplify the sentence by splitting it into two shorter sentences, and use simpler connectors. Similarly, the phrase “contraception (methods to prevent pregnancy)” introduces a parenthetical definition that raises the register. Instead, use a simpler construction such as “In the 1960s, people gained wider access to contraception, and the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two.” These adjustments will reduce complexity and align the text with B1 CEFR requirements.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died young. So the world’s population grew quickly. Large families had even more children. Many of these children grew up and then had children of their own.

Contraception means ways to stop having babies. In the 1960s, people gained wider access to contraception, and the average number of babies each woman had fell from six to two.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as 'A2' which is below the required 'B1' level. This is likely due to the prevalence of very short, simple sentences and the absence of B1-level linking words. For example, the sentences 'Large families had even more children.' and 'Many of these children grew up and then had children of their own.' stand alone without connectors. To reach B1, integrate sentences using connectors such as 'as a result', 'therefore', or 'consequently' and introduce simple subordinate clauses. You can also replace overly simple phrases like 'stop having babies' with 'prevent pregnancy' to elevate the lexical complexity and meet the B1 requirement.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health have meant that fewer children died young, and consequently the world’s population grew rapidly as large families had more children who survived into adulthood and then had children of their own. Contraception (methods used to prevent pregnancy) became widely available in the 1960s; therefore, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as 'B2' likely because it uses advanced connectors and sentence structures beyond B1 level. For example, the sentence "Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health have meant that fewer children died young, and consequently the world’s population grew rapidly..." includes the B2-level adverb "consequently" and a long, multi-clause structure. Similarly, the semicolon in "Contraception (methods used to prevent pregnancy) became widely available in the 1960s; therefore, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two." increases complexity. To meet B1 standards, replace "consequently" with a simpler connector such as "so" or "and so", split long sentences into shorter ones, and remove semicolons in favor of separate sentences.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, technology and health improved. Fewer children died young, so the world’s population grew rapidly. Many families had more children who survived into adulthood and then had children of their own. Contraception (methods used to stop a woman getting pregnant) became available in the 1960s. After that, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as 'A2', meaning it is too simple for B1. Sentences such as "Over the last two centuries, technology and health improved." and "Contraception (methods used to stop a woman getting pregnant) became available in the 1960s." are short and use basic structures. To reach B1, use more varied sentence patterns and connect ideas with B1-level linkers. For example, combine clauses with conjunctions like "leading to" or "resulting in" instead of separate sentences, integrate definitions into the sentence without parentheses, and add linking words such as "as a result", "however", or "meanwhile" to create more complex, fluent text.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health have meant that fewer children died at a young age, resulting in a rapid rise in the world’s population as larger families had more children who reached adulthood and became parents themselves. However, when contraception, which means methods that stop a woman getting pregnant, became widely available in the 1960s, the average number of babies born per woman fell from six to two.
Feedback received: Grade 6/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as "B2" likely because of complex structures and long sentences that exceed B1 level. For example, the sentence "However, when contraception, which means methods that stop a woman getting pregnant, became widely available in the 1960s, the average number of babies born per woman fell from six to two." uses a non-essential relative clause and the advanced phrase "became widely available." To meet B1 requirements, split this into shorter sentences and simplify vocabulary and connectors. For instance: "In the 1960s, contraception became more common. Contraception is a method that stops a woman getting pregnant. After that, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two." This will reduce complexity and ensure a clear B1 level.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died at a young age. This led to rapid growth in the world population. Large families had more children who reached adulthood and had children of their own. In the 1960s, contraception became more common. Contraception is a method that stops a woman getting pregnant. After that, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two.
Feedback received: Grade 9/10 - PASS

metadata.feedback_text: The output is factually accurate and preserves all key details from the original. MeaningBERT (0.908) and BERTScore (0.9438) both exceed the required thresholds, and the text is correctly classified at the B1 level. Sentence splitting and connectors (Over the last two centuries, This led to, In the 1960s, After that) create a clear and logical flow. You also properly defined the keyword contraception. To refine further, consider reintroducing the word global for clarity (average number of babies per woman worldwide) and using the plural form ’women getting pregnant’ for greater grammatical consistency. You might also vary your vocabulary slightly by replacing ‘more common’ with alternatives like ‘wider’ or ‘greater’ availability to avoid repetition.
